identity.name: E1
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Swiss Poster aesthetics with SaaS utility.
Content is King: Data density is a feature, not a bug for IT admins.
Contrast: Use stark black/white contrast to guide attention.
Negative Space: Use whitespace to group functional areas, not just for decoration.

headings.usage: Use for all page titles, section headers, and modal titles. Tracking tight (-0.02em).

body.usage: Use for all data tables, form labels, and paragraphs. Excellent legibility for alphanumeric codes.

mono.usage: Use for Asset IDs, Serial Numbers, and IP addresses.

typography.installation: Import via Google Fonts in index.css: @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=IBM+Plex+Sans:wght@400;500;600&family=JetBrains+Mono:wght@400;500&family=Manrope:wght@500;600;700;800&display=swap');

primary.description: Deep Slate (Obsidian). Use for primary buttons, active states, and key text.

secondary.description: Slate 100. Use for secondary buttons, backgrounds of sidebar/headers.

accent.description: Electric Blue. Use sparingly for 'Call to Action' or active links.

cards.style: Flat, 1px border (border-slate-200), no shadow. Hover: shadow-sm + border-slate-300 transition-all duration-200.

tables.style: Dense. Header: bg-slate-50 text-slate-500 uppercase text-xs font-bold tracking-wider. Row: hover:bg-slate-50/50 transition-colors.
tables.features: Zebra striping not required if borders are used. Use 'whitespace-nowrap' for data cells.

inputs.style: bg-white border-slate-200 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-slate-900/20 focus:border-slate-900 transition-all

visual_enhancers.textures: None. Keep it sterile and clean.
visual_enhancers.shadows: Minimalist. Use 'shadow-sm' for dropdowns and modals. Avoid large diffuse shadows.
visual_enhancers.icons: Lucide React (default). Use stroke-width={1.5} for a refined look.

motion.interactions: Hover: slight lift (-1px) for cards. Active: scale-95 for buttons.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Install 'recharts' for the dashboard charts.
2. THEME: Ensure 'Manrope' is applied to all headings and 'IBM Plex Sans' to body in index.css.
3. LAYOUT: Create a persistent 'Sidebar' component. Do not use a top-nav for the main structure.
4. DASHBOARD: Implement the 'Bento Grid' (Mode B) for the main dashboard. Use 'recharts' for a 'Loans over time' area chart.
5. FORMS: Use 'react-hook-form' with 'zod' (standard in Shadcn) for the Equipment Registration and Transaction forms.
6. TABLES: Use 'TanStack Table' (Shadcn DataTable) for the Equipment List and History. Implement filtering and sorting.
7. DOCUMENTS: Mock the OneDrive integration visually. Use a file upload dropzone (lucide 'UploadCloud' icon).
8. MOCK DATA: Generate realistic mock data for 10-15 items to populate the dashboard immediately.
10. TESTID: Add data-testid to all buttons, inputs, and links.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) sparingly (only for modals/overlays in this corporate context).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...)
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...})
